TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Style extends DocumentFormat.OpenXml.OpenXmlLeafElement

Docs.summary: style. When the object is serialized out as xml, its qualified name is m:sty.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlnoticeiso.md)] **sty (style)** This element describes the script applied to the characters in the run. The XML includes the Unicode value of the character along with the style of the character. The application maps the value and style to the appropriate Unicode range. Whether the element is absent or present without the val attribute, the default of the val attribute is *i*. [*Example*: ```xml ab ``` *end example*] |Parent Elements| |---------------------| |rPr (§22.1.2.91)| |Attributes|Description| |----------------|-----------------| |val (Value)|Specifies the style of the parent element. Possible values are *b* (bold), *i* (italic), *bi* (bold-italic), and *p* (plain).

The possible values for this attribute are defined by the *ST_Style* simple type (§22.1.3.12).| [*Note*: The W3C XML Schema definition of this element’s content model (CT_Style) is located in §A.6.1. *end note*] [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlcopyrightiso.md)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Val As EnumValue(Of StyleValues)

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following information from the ECMA International [Standard ECMA-376](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-376.htm) can be useful when working with this class.
Specifies the style of the parent element. Possible values are `b` (bold), `i` (italic), `bi` (bold-italic), and `p` (plain).
The possible values for this attribute are defined by the `ST_Style` simple type.
